summary: This is an email chain from July 12, 2019, regarding scheduling an attorney visit for inmate (78514-054), identified as Jeffrey Epstein, at the New York Metropolitan Correctional Center. The email is forwarded by a Supervisory Staff Attorney to facility staff to coordinate the visit with defense attorney Bruce Barket.

persons.name: Bruce Barket
persons.context: He is the attorney requesting to visit his client, inmate (78514-054), on Sunday, July 15, 2019, at 8:00 am. He expresses appreciation for the coordination.

persons.name: Supervisory Staff Attorney CLC
persons.context: A staff attorney at the New York Metropolitan Correctional Center who forwards the email request to facility staff to ensure the inmate is ready for the attorney visit.

connections.description: Bruce Barket is scheduling a visit to see his client, inmate (78514-054), at the correctional center.

events.title: Scheduled Attorney Visit for Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Defense attorney Bruce Barket is scheduled to visit his client, inmate (78514-054), at the New York Metropolitan Correctional Center at 8:00 am.

locations: New York Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
Barket, Epstein, Kearon, Aldea & LoTurco, 666 Old Country road, Garden City, NY 11530
keyFacts: The email coordinates a legal visit for inmate (78514-054), widely understood to be Jeffrey Epstein, at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.
The visit was scheduled for Sunday, July 15, 2019, at 8:00 am, just days before Epstein's death on July 23, 2019.
Bruce Barket of the law firm Barket, Epstein, Kearon, Aldea & LoTurco is identified as the visiting attorney.
The communication highlights the operational procedures for attorney-client visits within the federal detention facility.
The email is dated July 12, 2019, and marked as 'High' importance, indicating urgent coordination was needed.
